title: CMS Custom Modules Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of building custom plugins and modules for content management systems.

questions.question: In WordPress, what is the difference between an 'action' and a 'filter'?

options.text: Actions modify data, filters trigger events
Actions execute code at specific points, filters modify data before it's used
They are the same thing with different names
Actions are for the admin, filters are for the front-end

questions.explanation: Actions (do_action/add_action) let you execute custom code at specific points in the WordPress lifecycle. Filters (apply_filters/add_filter) let you modify data as it passes through the system before it's rendered or saved.

questions.question: Custom WordPress plugins should directly modify core WordPress files to add functionality.
questions.explanation: Never modify core files — updates will overwrite your changes. WordPress provides hooks (actions and filters) specifically for extending functionality without touching core code.

questions.question: What is a WordPress 'Custom Post Type'?

options.text: A special kind of blog comment
A custom content type beyond posts and pages, like 'Products' or 'Events'
A plugin that creates social media posts

questions.explanation: Custom Post Types extend WordPress beyond 'Posts' and 'Pages' to handle any content structure — Products, Events, Testimonials, Portfolios, etc. Each gets its own admin interface, URLs, and template hierarchy.

questions.question: What is the Gutenberg block editor in WordPress?

options.text: A code editor for PHP files
A block-based content editor where content is composed of individual blocks
A CSS framework for WordPress themes

questions.explanation: Gutenberg is WordPress's block editor where content is built from individual blocks (paragraph, image, heading, custom blocks). Developers can create custom blocks using React and the @wordpress/blocks package.

questions.question: What should always be included when creating a custom CMS plugin?

options.text: Data sanitization, validation, and proper security nonces
Integration with every social media platform
Custom database tables for every feature

questions.explanation: Security is critical in CMS plugins. Always sanitize input (sanitize_text_field), validate data types, use nonces to prevent CSRF attacks, and check user capabilities before performing actions.
